page.title: 03Housing Renovation-Denbeath
page.content: When the Wellesley Colliery was closed in l967, miners moved out of Denbeath and many of the houses became damp and overrun with mice through lack of repair. Some of the pupils in our class used to live in them until their parents decided to move out of these bad conditions into council houses. In l981 seven streets of houses were sold to developers, who decided to renovate them.To date,parts of Forth,Clyde.Tay and Tweed Streets have been renovated and sold.These houses are now in better condition and have central heating,which the old houses did not have.This makes them warmer although some owners are still complaining about dampness. The rest of the property bought by the developers is in a derelict state.
